title.value: NEURO-GPT: TOWARDS A FOUNDATION MODEL FOR EEG
title.justification: The paper clearly states this title in the header.
title.quote: NEURO-GPT: TOWARDS A FOUNDATION MODEL FOR EEG

extractions.description: This paper introduces Neuro-GPT, a foundation model combining an EEG encoder with a GPT model, aimed at improving classification performance in Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) tasks by leveraging large-scale pre-training and fine-tuning strategies.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental validation of the proposed Neuro-GPT model using pre-training and fine-tuning on datasets, and evaluates its performance through empirical results.
type.quote: Our experiments demonstrate that applying a foundation model can significantly improve classification performance compared to a model trained from scratch

name.justification: The paper's main focus is on improving EEG-based Brain-Computer Interface tasks using the Neuro-GPT model.
name.quote: To handle the scarcity and heterogeneity of electroencephalography (EEG) data for Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) tasks, and to harness the power of large publicly available data sets, we propose Neuro-GPT

name.justification: The foundation model Neuro-GPT is pre-trained using a self-supervised task that reconstructs masked EEG segments.
name.quote: The foundation model is pre-trained on a large-scale data set using a self-supervised task that learns how to reconstruct masked EEG segments

name.justification: The paper employs a Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) model as part of its Neuro-GPT architecture.
name.quote: We employ a Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) model [10], which uses a decoder-only transformer architecture

name.justification: The proposed foundation model described in the paper is named Neuro-GPT and combines an EEG encoder with a GPT model.
name.quote: we propose Neuro-GPT, a foundation model consisting of an EEG encoder and a GPT model

is_contributed.justification: The paper's primary contribution is the Neuro-GPT model.
is_contributed.quote: we propose Neuro-GPT, a foundation model consisting of an EEG encoder and a GPT model

is_executed.justification: The paper describes experiments where the Neuro-GPT model is executed to validate its performance.
is_executed.quote: Our experiments demonstrate that applying a foundation model can significantly improve classification performance compared to a model trained from scratch

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of Neuro-GPT with other models, including BENDR.
is_compared.quote: we compare the proposed Neuro-GPT with BENDR [8], a BERT-inspired transformer model trained on TUH EEG data using contrastive self-supervised learning

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper for Neuro-GPT as it is the primary contribution of this paper.

name.justification: BENDR is used as a baseline model for comparison in the Neuro-GPT paper.
name.quote: we compare the proposed Neuro-GPT with BENDR [8], a BERT-inspired transformer model trained on TUH EEG data using contrastive self-supervised learning

is_contributed.justification: BENDR is not a contribution of this paper but is used for comparison.
is_contributed.quote: BENDR [8], a BERT-inspired transformer model trained on TUH EEG data using contrastive self-supervised learning

is_executed.justification: The Neuro-GPT paper does not execute BENDR but references its performance for comparison.
is_executed.quote: As shown in Table 1, Neuro-GPT significantly improved the classification performance compared with the best performance of BENDR

is_compared.justification: The performance of Neuro-GPT is compared with that of BENDR in the paper.
is_compared.quote: we compare the proposed Neuro-GPT with BENDR [8], a BERT-inspired transformer model trained on TUH EEG data using contrastive self-supervised learning

referenced_paper_title.value: BENDR: using transformers and a contrastive self-supervised learning task to learn from massive amounts of EEG data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for the BENDR model is titled 'BENDR: using transformers and a contrastive self-supervised learning task to learn from massive amounts of EEG data'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: BENDR: using transformers and a contrastive self-supervised learning task to learn from massive amounts of EEG data

name.justification: The TUH EEG corpus is used as the pre-training dataset for the foundation model Neuro-GPT.
name.quote: The foundation model is pre-trained on the TUH EEG dataset [11]

referenced_paper_title.value: The temple university hospital eeg data corpus
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for the TUH EEG corpus is titled 'The temple university hospital eeg data corpus'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The temple university hospital eeg data corpus

name.justification: The BCI Competition IV Dataset 2a is used for the downstream motor imagery classification task to fine-tune the Neuro-GPT model.
name.quote: using the BCI Competition IV Dataset 2a provided by Graz University of Technology [17]

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for the BCI Competition IV Dataset 2a is titled 'Bci competition 2008–graz data set a'.

name.justification: The Neuro-GPT implementation uses the open-source GPT-2 model provided by Hugging Face.
name.quote: We employ the open-source GPT-2 [10] model provided by Hugging Face [16]

referenced_paper_title.value: Huggingface’s transformers: State-of-the-art natural language processing
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for the Hugging Face Transformers library is titled 'Huggingface’s transformers: State-of-the-art natural language processing'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Huggingface’s transformers: State-of-the-art natural language processing
